column1: 1. What is the main purpose of project scope management?,Defining objectives
column4: Ensuring all work required is included,Ensuring all work required is included

column1: 2. What is NOT included in a project scope statement?,Budget constraints
3. What does a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) represent?,Project budget
4. Which process involves defining and documenting stakeholder needs?,Planning scope
5. What is the main tool used for creating a WBS?,Benchmarking
6. Which process ensures project deliverables meet scope?,Planning scope
7. What is scope creep?,Uncontrolled changes
8. What document outlines how scope will be managed?,Project charter
9. What is the first step in project scope management?,Collecting requirements
10. Which technique is used to compare project practices?,Observation
11. What is the purpose of a Gantt chart?,Defining scope
12. What does CPM stand for?,Cost Performance Management
13. What is a milestone?,Project risk
14. What does PERT stand for?,Project Execution and Review
column4: Program Execution and Review,Program Evaluation and Review

column1: 15. Which diagram shows the sequence of activities?,Mind map
16. What is the main purpose of schedule management?,Defining scope
17. What does "float" refer to in scheduling?,Resource allocation
18. What is the critical path?,Longest path
19. What is a three-point estimate used for?,Estimating costs
20. What is the main output of schedule control?,Project charter
21. What is life cycle costing?,Evaluating schedule
22. What does EVM stand for?,Earned Value Management
23. What does AC stand for in EVM?,Actual Cost
24. What is a cost baseline?,Approved budget
25. Which process aggregates estimated costs?,Estimating costs
26. What is the formula for CPI?,EV/AC
27. What does variance analysis involve?,Evaluating scope
28. What is the purpose of cost control?,Tracking schedule
column4: Managing scope,Ensuring costs are within budget

column1: 29. What is a direct cost?,Fixed cost
30. What is planned value (PV)?,Realized cost
31. What is the main goal of quality management?,Ensuring costs minimized
32. What is NOT a quality control method?,Six Sigma
33. What does a control chart determine?,Scope status
34. What is a Pareto chart used for?,Tracking schedule
35. What is another name for a cause-and-effect diagram?,Flowchart
36. What is the first step in quality management planning?,Managing metrics
37. What is the purpose of quality assurance?,Tracking schedule
38. What is the main output of quality control?,Scope statement
39. What is statistical sampling used for?,Estimating costs
40. What is the role of a quality audit?,Reviewing scope
41. What is the main purpose of resource management?,Tracking costs
42. What does RACI stand for?,Responsible&cAccountable&cConsulted&cInformed
43. What is resource leveling?,Increasing costs
44. Which process improves team competencies?,Planning resources
45. What is the first step in resource management?,Planning resources
46. What is a resource histogram?,Tracking costs
47. What does "conflict management" refer to?,Tracking schedule
48. What is a common technique for team building?,Scope management
49. What is emotional intelligence?,Managing scope
50. What is NOT an output of controlling resources?,Project scope statement
